reviews.text: The staff always puts on a great event whenever I’ve come for their viewings. They always give lots of historical trivia about the building/location, and their presenters are always so passionate about astronomy; it really comes through during the events. I highly recommend the doing one of date nights.

Situated on a beautiful little campus, the Cincinnati Observatory was an excellent elementary school field trip. The very friendly and informative staff can teach you a lot about history and astronomy, both local and universal. Even in midday sun, they can use telescopes to see and study the sun, but obviously after dark is the best time to visit. It's an indispensable gem for architecture, art, math, nature, science, and, most importantly community.

Amazing historical observatory. A must visit for anyone interested in astronomy, mathematics, the sciences, or history. The volunteers are knowledgeable and run the tours smoothly. It's definitely a place I will be recommending to all my friends and family.
It's a small quite location at the top of the Cincinnati area and has a great view. It's a few minutes from the park. It's not the biggest observatory but it's a really relaxing place.
Wonderful place. They offer classes some evenings that are extremely educational and entertaining. If you love history and are interested in astronomy, this place is a must visit for you.

It’s so pretty. Can have so peaceful walks on the bridge. It’s the suspension bridge. On the other end of the bridge they had the drawings of how the bridge was constructed and how that area was before and after. Can spend like more than 1 hour in this place . It’s so good to see during the nights than at the day light.

This is a true and real piece of history and its a beautiful sight in the day or at night.   The John A. Roebling Suspension bridge was the prototype (I believe) for the Brooklyn Bridge in New York City.  Its fun to see it as you look at the Ohio River and do not expect a smaller version of what you see in NYC.  It sits on one side in Covington, KY and the other in Cincinnati, OH.  Take a stroll or view it from either side easily.  Worth a visit if you are OH or KY.

This is my favorite place at Cincinati Area. Always feels good walking from Ohio to Kentucky and taking  photos. Best place for short walk, Photography, and sightseeing. Landscape view from Kentucky side to Cincinati is so beautiful specially at night time. Parks, and Play ground for kids just entrance of the bridge. Best place to visit for family, romantic date and casual walk. It’s so beautiful and feels good when you get there.

That bridge is so beautiful. It was built in 1857. It’s on River Ohio. My favorite view there is in summer on night. Wether is perfect, it’s romantic plan for walking, and that place is close to good restaurants.

Beautiful structure! Amazing history to learn as well! There are also murals painted along the walls on the Covington side, telling the story of the area's development. A definite must see whether passing through, or if you live in the area!
Beautiful... awesome history... great views.  A great place to hang out and read, re-center, and wander around.
Absolutely stunning facility, extensive collection, and kind and helpful staff. This place is one of the jewels in the crown of the Queen city.

I came to Cincinnati for a drycleaners help with a jacket from the Second World War. The manager and I had great discussions about history. She said I should visit here. I am glad she told me of this place and that I got to stop by.
An oasis of quiet in a bustling city. Very welcoming staff and unique educational programs.

The Mercantile Library is not just a historic treasure, it is an active and vibrant library filled with both books and people who reflect the intrepid spirit of Cincinnati.  The events are rich, the space perfectly suited to learning without a hint of pretension, and the staff dedicated to the mission.  I don't think I will let another friend visit Cincinnati without letting them experience this gem.
Breath taking beauty and craftsmanship.
Beautiful Temple ass for garnish catering

I am new in the area and was very disappointed with my Friday night visit to the Wise temple. As a former office of a reform congregation I found the people very cold and uninviting. I was surprised there were no greaters and there was no effort by any of the congregants to approach or engage a stranger in their midst.
Beautiful architecture!
Beautiful architecture!

I have never visited the church, but Father Adrian stopped in to see my mother at Christ Hospital.  It was an impromptu request, but he followed up again the next day.  A wonderful, selfless act of kindness.  Thank you.
Beautiful Church, wonderful priests. Confession before almost every Mass.
Beautiful church. Too bad they say a bogus novus ordo mass.

The Holy Catholic Faith is truly prayed and lived within this sublime parish church as it ought! The sacred liturgy is resplendent. The Oratorian priests who staff the parish are true caretakers of the souls entrusted to them. The spiritual care provided sets the standard for the entire Archdiocese of Cincinnati. This vivacious faith is reflected in the sumptuous architecture of the building. You simply must go and attend Mass here to understand what I am talking about. Deo gratias!
Very nice place, very helpful and I would recommend if you need the help go there very nice people also! They care!

I would like to congratulate you on the spring 2014 edition of  Athenaeum: In a marvelous way it shows how the Athenaeum has continued to meet the needs of the Archdiocese with the changing times. There have been many great leaders of the Athenaeum and I appreciate that of Father Benedict. Father Anthony May [Diocese of San Diego].
This is building is so beautiful and amazing a truly remarkable place.

Gorgeous museum located in the beautiful Eden Park. Free admission, you only pay to get into certain exhibits. The museum is huge, with plenty of different art styles from many different eras and cultures. You could spend hours here. They have Art After Dark on weekends, which is free and includes live music. Definitely a great place to stop in Cincinnati. Located close to downtown Cincinnati.

I love the exhibits they show here. I love how there's inspirational quotes throughout the museum. I enjoyed getting to see art from all over and was absolutely grateful that is was free. It's always a great thing to be able to both learn and be inspired. This place is amazing and I wouldn't change a thing about it. I would definitely recommend this museum highly. It's a great and free outting with a wonderful selection of places to eat nearby 😊. I believe they even have a cafe inside in the lobby at the very least they have an awesome gift shoppe!

Free admission! FREE. ADMISSION. Nothing more should need to be said, but I will anyways. Parking is free, there's plenty of it, it's easy to get to from the highway, etc. The exhibits are lovely and rotated often enough that there's usually something new to see every visit. It's comfortably climate controlled. The view from outside is nice. The courtyard (inside? does it qualify since it's internal to the building but external?) is nice as well, and has the outdoor seating for the in museum Cafe (which also has indoor seating, and lots of windows). You're not allowed to carry huge bags in, but I had no trouble bringing a regular purse and my camera bag. Turn your flash off- by the way. 

They're happy to offer a map or answer any questions at the front desk lobby area, and they have a gift shop (the proceeds of which support the museum, I believe). Great article museum, and definitely worth killing a few hours here. Some of their Chinese art especially is gorgeous.

What an incredible way to spend the afternoon! The exhibits are varied, well laid out and maintained. There’s a nice flow and plenty to see for the whole family. Nice education area for the kids and amazing architecture is an added bonus. We paid the extra for the Fabric of India exhibit and were blown away. It closes soon, so get there if you can!

The Cincinnati Art Museum is a great art museum that carries a large variety of art. The museum has pieces from the classics and modern artists as well. Further, the building itself is very beautiful and a nice aesthetic experience that will heal your soul in the middle of a bustling city. The Cincinnati Art Museum has a large feature on the glass work that was made in Cincinnati and the greater Ohio area. This unique glassware collection is worth a visit for its local artistry..
Nice museum.  Very different in that it's the history of Cincinnati wrapped in a museum.
Fun for young kids to see, but nothing to interact with. Good exhibits and cheap for a an hour or so of fun
Very interesting place a must see
This place is awesome! Lots of fun for the kids and adults!
Very cool place to learn about fire equipment history and procedures. Lots of interactive things for kids.

For one of the oldest zoos in the country it was fabulous. Many of the exhibits are updated and all are educational. From giraffe feedings to animal encounters everything was designed to show the animals in natural habits and close enough to be seen. The cheetah encounter was very cool, must see. Even the insect house was awesome, with leaf cutter ants carrying their work through tubes and multicolored beetles in a grand display. The African safari was the best I've seen. Definitely a must view if in the Cincinnati ares

I love the zoo. For many people it's the only way they'll ever see the animals there. Currently, the Cincinnati Zoo is undergoing lots of renovations so there are multiple exhibits that are closed. However, there's still plenty to keep you occupied. I have a membership, which I highly recommend for anyone with younger kids since it allows you to visit multiple times and leave when they get tired instead of feeling like you need to stay all day to get your money's worth. A membership also allows you to enter the zoo 1 hour before the general public which helps with parking as well. Parking is fairly limited there. I love that you can take in food and drinks as it makes the day much more affordable. With a membership your food is discounted, though, so that helps. Definitely a fun place to spend a day. Grateful for abundant shade there, too, especially mid-summer.

A really fun experience. The zoo is laid out well and they have some attractions I haven't seen at the few other zoos I've been to (for example: their world of insects was creepy and awesome). Definitely worth making a day of if you're in the area visiting.

Can be very crowded depending on the day, as most zoos and similar attractions are.

What an awesome zoo! They have a lot of really cool animals. Fiona the baby hippo and her mom were really cool to see. When a girl got way too close they were super gentile with her and brought her to safety. Check out the picture I got... Crazy!

Great zoo with lots of interesting animals. I enjoyed the nocturnal animal exhibit. Areas marked for animal talks could be more accurately marked. For example it would be more helpful to list "near entrance of" instead of list the building itself. We entered the building where the location was marked not realizing the talk was outside.
Not worth the charge. Up keep poor  and very little to see. Paul lawerenc Dunbar house is much better and free.
Great discussion and film. Excellent tour guides. Just not handicapped accessible.
Interesting literary house museum in the Walnut Hills neighborhood. The local community has a cool history as well.
Great experience visiting this house on a Saturday morning and learning about its history. The guides were very helpful explaining things to us during the tour.
A really good place to learn about slavery era

The Taft Museum of Art is a masterpiece in itself. The museum is comprised of so many beautiful exhibits and artifacts. The place is really good option to visit with family. Moreover, the museum offers many activities for kids where they can have learning as well as fun. Learn while having fun. I went here with my family and the children in our family were very happy with this place. They enjoyed themselves and got to learn so much. The kids were so happy that they keep on asking about our next visit. This is a wonderful place.

Viewed the Tiffany Art glass display.  Beautiful! Also toured the entire museum,  well appointed with helpful docents.  Exterior sticks artwork incredible,  but really hid the front of the home. Will be displayed for two years! A must see!!

Terrific architecture inside and out, beautiful paintings, very informative if you are the type that likes to learn things when at a museum. GPS took me to the employee parking entrance, keep an eye out for that. Friendly and knowledgeable staff

Quaint museum with lovely gardens. Perhaps had we got here an hour before closing, our experience would have been more pleasant.
We were repeatedly told they were closing in x minutes, although I would look at the phone and see that they were just rushing us. This happened with every employee we encountered. 

The two guards at the O'Keeffe exhibit made us most uncomfortable. They lurked behind us and gave us warnings every three minutes that the museum was closing. We expressed that we were just there to see the O'Keeffe paintings, but that did not deter them. They made it awkward when my 9 year old wanted to take pictures with her favorite artist's paintings. I got the feeling they didnt appreciate a child being there. We went to go back to the O'Keeffe paintings, only to be told where the exit was.

I informed the gentleman that we just wanted to get one last look. He permitted us to do this. As we left, I noted that it was 4:53 and thanked him for their hospitality. He suggested we return when they weren't closing. I told him we traveled a long way to get there.

In the gift shop, they are closing in 5 minutes. At least this was near accurate. Credit cards only now. No problem. Another reminder of what time they closed and we left without buying anything. The previous day we had spent over $100 in gift shops. Not here.

On the way out, I stepped to the side to see the exquisite gardens only to be informed that this was not the way out. 

Get out. We got the message. It was 5:00 and  we were getting into our car in the garage. Three minutes later, they shut the main gate. Great. 🙄

With regards to the exhibit itself, there were two O'Keeffe pieces. It was quiet and not very welcoming, but with a nice selection and variation of pieces.

We were super excited to see this museum. Happy it was free. 

NOT family friendly. The only place we visited that was rude in this area. We joked how we had just said how nice and polite people in Ohio are and then the Taft museum proved us wrong. Will not return. 😡

Wonderful museum of the brother of President William Howard Taft. Really great art and ceramics. Amazing mosaics. When we visited, there was a special event of Tiffany glass that was just gorgeous. Nice gift shop, too. The Cafe was closed by the time we got done with the museum, so I can't comment on it.

This place is AWESOME! Not only is it visually stunning, but learning about the history of signs, their materials and typography was fascinating. I love that they have it organized by era, so with each piece and room you’re walking into a new one. Highly recommend this hidden gem off the beaten path in Cincinnati. Well worth the trip.

A fantastic passionate museum giving a history of signs, one of those pieces of life we don't think about much but are surrounded by. The galleries look small, but walking each way through them brings a different experience. I'm already looking forward to returning.

It was really neat and we had a good time. It was not big at all but the signs were placed in an organized fashion that allowed you to take your time and kind of get lost in the nostalgia. A lot of the signs are from the 70s or older so it was cool to see how far things have advanced and the changes certain companies had mad to their logo over time.

It makes me happy there is a place like this in Cincinnati. Very cool and unique. Went with the wife on a Sunday afternoon and appreciated all the old sign technology. Unfortunately there was a group of instagrammers that were very rude, but management was very understanding and gave us free passes to come back again. Will definitely be back and would recommend to anyone to check this place out.

Cool place.  Its like taking a walk through history.  Just manage your expectations appropriately.  I went as a work function for free.  Id pay like $10 to get in... maybe $15.  It would prob take an hour to get through the displays if you take your time.
AWESOME

Unique historical building in downtown that houses a wide array of artists from painters to sculptors to stained glass. Really fascinating artists, and building. Consider attending on of their open houses on the final Friday of each month. A great way to be inspired or pick up a local unique piece which will also support local artists. 10/10 - highly recommend.
The final Friday events are always neat. They are well put together and it's great to meet and support the artists. It is a neat space and is great that they can provide a venue for so many artists.
Was there for Final Friday and only made it to 3 floors in one building! What a great collection of art. Must go back!

Final Friday is always an enjoyable time. People, art, wine, and great energy. Bring friends, family, a first date... and a few dollars to support Cincinnati artists. You will find at least one thing you can't leave without.
Wonderful art and SO much of it!
Small but awesome gallery that changes almost monthly

My. Echo Park has great views of the city and river. Great place to take the family to play at the park or explore the many nature walks. Great place to get married and has many gazebos and buildings to rent and use. One of the best parks in greater Cincinnati.

Enjoy the chilly weather. Park has awesome views as it is covered with yellow trees. There were squirrels all around and birds were chirping. It was a great time with family. Must visit once to enjoy the scenes.
A lot of kids were out enjoying the nice weather playing basketball. It was a great time.
Always have liked this place very nice view of the river and downtown Cincinnati! No complaints!

Nice park, great over look of the cincy skyline if that's your style. My style is more being an adult on the one swingset I could find. Rebellion. 

Nice trees. Go there and appreciate some nice trees and get a good look at the city and also Kentucky. Kentucky is visable too.

Beautiful place, worth visiting worth driving. Eden is like heaven. Is like no where else in the world. We went with Family and friends and we really enjoyed every step of the way. The view was spectacular. We walked all over Eden Park visiting Mirror Lake and all the Lookouts of the Ohio River . The sidewalks are in great shape and most of the walkers were very friendly. It's nice to get out and enjoy the sights .
I had a lovely time at this park. It seems very big so bring a bike. I like to play a game and this location was great for the game i play. #ingress

I love this place. For quiet hiking I wouldn't recommend. It can be heavy trafficked, esp during summer and spring. But gorgeous view of the river and Kentucky! Great fountain to walk around. Right by the conservatory and also right by Art Museum!!! Special place right in the heart of Cincinnati
Great place to run,  walk or just sit in your car and relax.  Nice park for the kids and some of the best views in the city.

If you are in town, I would suggest you visit here. A thrilling place to sit and watch people. It is a clean park full of people enjoying themselves and the surroundings. You will feel safe and relaxed. The neighborhood is great. It's a classic park. I highly recommend you to visit here on weekends.

I've been going to the Krohn Conservatory since I was a child. It was amazing then & is even better now. The Holiday display never disappoints. The color & wonder of the season is embellished in every way. I really like what they've done with the cactus room and the original wood pieces. It really adds to the feel. The bonsai room & orchid terrarium is luscious and amazing..

I've been going to the Krohn Conservatory since I was a child. It was amazing then & is even better now. The Holiday display never disappoints. The color & wonder of the season is embellished in every way. I really like what they've done with the cactus room and the original wood pieces. It really adds to the feel. The bonsai room & orchid terrarium is luscious and amazing.

I've been going to the Krohn Conservatory since I was a child. It was amazing then & is even better now. The Holiday display never disappoints. The color & wonder of the season is embellished in every way. I really like what they've done with the cactus room and the original wood pieces. It really adds to the feel. The bonsai room & orchid terrarium is luscious and amazing.

I 've been going to the Krohn Conservatory since I was a child. It was amazing then & is even better now. The Holiday display never disappoints. The color & wonder of the season is embellished in every way. I really like what they've done with the cactus room and the original wood pieces. It really adds to the feel. The bonsai room & orchid terrarium is luscious and amazing.

We went to see the butterflies of Ecuador.  The butterflies were beautiful.  The area with the butterflies wasn't as big as we expected but was still quite enjoyable.  The variety of plants was surprising and the waterfall was relaxing.  I would recommend it!

Some of the trails are not super duper maintained, but seeing as how it is out of season for hiking, I don't blame them. The highway is audible from the majority of the park. I like the cool bridges the best. They also have disc golf! I have never been, but I think it's cool that it's available.

Mt Airy Forest contains one of the best disc golf courses in the greater Cincinnati area.  Challenging course for a new player, but rewarding for people who really want to work on their game.  I highly recommend coming here to shop for discs as well.  The guys in the shop and knowledgeable and passionate about disc golf.  Come out to enjoy the course, or support the shop.
It's a pretty place to picnic with family or friends. It's sad what is popular as it used to be growing visiting there. But some of my best childhood memories were made there.
Beautiful park. Love coming here just to relax and enjoy nature. Has great hiking trails and hidden waterfalls and creeks.

Well maintained city park and trails. Maintenance personnel helpful and friendly.The administration building has restrooms, and some classrooms.
There are outside restrooms. 
The park has several areas for groups to meet for activities. I have attended a sunrise wedding here!
Best ferret veterinarian I've met. The doctor is very knowledgeable about them and was able to successfully treat one of mine when other vets said they could not. The staff are all friendly, too.
Only vet I can find that will see my hedgehog and guinea pigs. They are great more than 5 stars
Dr. LeVitas is so compassionate about his animals. Does a great job.

Each and every person on staff here cares so much about the short term and long term well being of you pets. The doctors are not at all in a hurry, but instead let you take your time in asking all the questions you would be curious about and also be open and honest about the cost. 

I understand more about not only my cats' health, but their diet, behavior, and growth, with a peace of mind that is in line with my budget.

Excellent place to take your pets. Dr. Paul Levitas and his staff are the best in Cincinnati. He has seen our cats and now our puppy and is just amazing. Highly recommend taking your pets here, awesome care.

Had a great evening as I was part of Moerlein’s service offering for a pal’s wedding rehearsal dinner. The food was immaculate. So immaculate, that I forgot to pull out my camera to capture the great quality and the great experience. But I did however manage to snag this as another pal enjoys his bread. Can’t wait to go back very very soon.
Had early evening dinner. This place is amazing. Our waiter was on top of things the whole time and we wanted for nothing. We will be back. I recommend you go there, if you get the chance.

The best part was as the amazing service from our server Mikey. He was a attentive and timely. He recommended great drinks and food. My fish tacos where excellent. The creme brulee was a little over cooked. Otherwise, the atmosphere was amazing for catching up with friends for a birthday gathering. We will return for sure!

A great atmosphere with a lot of glass walls and a great overlook of the river and Great American Ballpark. The staff was quick with our order and attentive. A great place to have a beer on a nice afternoon.
This location is absolutely outstanding. The staff was very sociable and kind. The prices are well within reason for the quality. This place has good reviews for a reason.

For one of the oldest zoos in the country it was fabulous. Many of the exhibits are updated and all are educational. From giraffe feedings to animal encounters everything was designed to show the animals in natural habits and close enough to be seen. The cheetah encounter was very cool, must see. Even the insect house was awesome, with leaf cutter ants carrying their work through tubes and multicolored beetles in a grand display. The African safari was the best I've seen. Definitely a must view if in the Cincinnati ares

I love the zoo. For many people it's the only way they'll ever see the animals there. Currently, the Cincinnati Zoo is undergoing lots of renovations so there are multiple exhibits that are closed. However, there's still plenty to keep you occupied. I have a membership, which I highly recommend for anyone with younger kids since it allows you to visit multiple times and leave when they get tired instead of feeling like you need to stay all day to get your money's worth. A membership also allows you to enter the zoo 1 hour before the general public which helps with parking as well. Parking is fairly limited there. I love that you can take in food and drinks as it makes the day much more affordable. With a membership your food is discounted, though, so that helps. Definitely a fun place to spend a day. Grateful for abundant shade there, too, especially mid-summer.

A really fun experience. The zoo is laid out well and they have some attractions I haven't seen at the few other zoos I've been to (for example: their world of insects was creepy and awesome). Definitely worth making a day of if you're in the area visiting.

Can be very crowded depending on the day, as most zoos and similar attractions are.

What an awesome zoo! They have a lot of really cool animals. Fiona the baby hippo and her mom were really cool to see. When a girl got way too close they were super gentile with her and brought her to safety. Check out the picture I got... Crazy!

Great zoo with lots of interesting animals. I enjoyed the nocturnal animal exhibit. Areas marked for animal talks could be more accurately marked. For example it would be more helpful to list "near entrance of" instead of list the building itself. We entered the building where the location was marked not realizing the talk was outside.
best college ever I can watch anime in peace and I made a bunch of friends that I'm still friends with now thank you Xavier I hope you inspire more students :)
Always a good time with the musketeers!
Had fun checking out Xavier University today!

Way too focused on religion/sports

I want an education.
We had the opportunity to play in a basketball tournament at the Cintas Center in high school. Memorable experience and the coolest court I was ever able to play on!

I've worked here for close to 2 years part-time. As a part-time analyst, most of my time was spent behind computer screens. I did periodically engage in activities like volunteer work, but most of the time I spent my time in the office. Most of the time I interacted with people via email, so it was common for people to see my name, not necessarily a face. When I announced I was leaving, I was shocked how many people were so kind and supportive (I was leaving for a career opportunity) because as I said, I spent a lot of time behind my computer rather than out and about excluding some things like volunteering. Even the President himself came to talk to me. This is an example of the wonderfulness of the Mount: from beginning to end, no matter where you work, whether you're part-time or full-time, staff or faculty, you are family. You are loved. You are valued. Management cares for its employees and listens. I truly enjoyed my time working here. There are so many wonderful people who work here and I will miss them all. Thank you, Mount St. Joseph, for providing me the foundation to grow my skills, and for being such a welcoming community.

I was accepted to the college and moved in this fall. They called me to the office on my first day and told me I owed $5,000 or I would be sent home if i failed to pay it by the end of the week. So i went home. I was never told that I had to pay all my tuition before school even started. Financial aid office never gave me a payment plan, offers for scholarships or loans. This school lacks Catholic values and was not helpful students in need of aid. Don't recommend.
If you are looking for a true Catholic school, this is not the place to go. I was very disappointed with the staff and how they didn't even try to help me. I experienced this all first hand and it was one of the worst experiences of my life. Being kicked out of my top choice school was not how i wanted to start my first year of college.

Definitely consider your options for a school. If you choose mount st jo make sure you keep track of your financial aid and get detailed information about your classes and costs. They seem to skimp on telling people that. Don’t believe all the reviews about how awesome the school is. They were written by the staff.
Walnut Hills HS '18 & MSJ '22

Best education, best people, best support, best experience.
Highly highly highly recommend MSJ.  It was more than an education.
I left very well prepared for a healthy, happy, successful life.
Will always be grateful and feel blessed that I am a MSJ graduate.
best college ever I can watch anime in peace and I made a bunch of friends that I'm still friends with now thank you Xavier I hope you inspire more students :)
Always a good time with the musketeers!
Had fun checking out Xavier University today!

Way too focused on religion/sports

I want an education.
We had the opportunity to play in a basketball tournament at the Cintas Center in high school. Memorable experience and the coolest court I was ever able to play on!

As I've come to expect this establishment always delivers! The burgers are second to none and the service this time was excellent. I haven't really ever ordered much else when I'm here besides one of the burgers so I can't speak to the rest of the menu. The ambience is quaint and simple and no reason to dress up. The service was fast and accurate and the food was piping hot. As I have always loved a good cheeseburger, I think about this place when I suggest where to go in town to find a great burger and fries experience! I'm happy to always refer people to visit Arthur's. There's also some outdoor seating and this time of year that is always a plus! Be ready to pay for parking! But that's okay!

Arthur's is one of those places when you walk in you feel like everyone should know your name and gives you a comfy at home feeling.  The breakfast burger was really good but the chicken tenders were a little dry.  But with that being said they're not known for the chicken fingers but they are known for burgers and the one I had was a good one. It was hot,  cheese melted perfectly with an egg on top.  Definitely worth the stop,

Read online that this was the best fish sandwich in town, so we thought we'd give it a try. Got the cod sandwich and it was delicious. Hard to say if it's the best in town but it's definitely the best fish sandwich I've had in years. Service was super quick, in and out in 30 minutes. Highly recommend, would return.

Friend provolone cheese was delicious.
I had the Arthur burger with blue cheese.  Delicious.
Date had roast beef on rye. Delicious.
Kid had mini corn dogs. Delicious.
Service was slow but excellent.
Friendly spot, hood mixed drinks and good brunch.  Its cleaned for the most part and has a nice little back patio if you want to eat outdoors... relaxing and unpretentious...

I hadn't expected the burger to be so tall! The service staff is nice. They work quickly. The kitchen puts out burgers quick, so if you go when they're not busy, you can have a very quick meal. They're very popular. It's almost a full house when I pop in, no matter the day, but I can always find a spot at the bar. The Mac & cheese is all kinds of cheesy, hot & good. The loaded fries are what you'd expect after reading the menu: yum! I ordered the IPA cheese burger recently, & didn't care for the texture of the beer cheese, the bacon on the burger, & its pairing to mushrooms. The burger was still good, but I won't order it again.

This place isn't in the safest area but they do have ample parking (though there are no lights in the parking lot). That being said, it's an awesome restaurant with great food. It truly is one of those "hole in the wall" places that makes you keep coming back due to their amazing food.

The first time I went here was kind of on a whim, had simply seen it had good reviews on google and I was living on Xavier’s campus for the summer so it was close by.  After eating there now a couple times, it’s one of the best burger places I’ve been to in Cincinnati, possibly the best.  The burgers are kind of interesting in that they are very tall, with the meat being very round almost like a slightly flattened meat ball, instead of like a typical patty being fairly flat on the top and bottom.  The first time I got the hangover burger which has three additional types of meat on it, plus cheeses, onion strings, and sauce.  It was burger heaven!  The second time I was less hungry and simply got a cheese burger but was still delicious.  The fries aren’t anything fancy, basically steak fries, but are still very good.  Next time I’m there I’m going for the BPJ which is banana, peanut butter, and jam.  Sounds funky but I’ve got to try it.

Wonderful ambiance, absolutely AMAZING food. Our server was more than you could ask for, friendly, knowledgeable and always smiling. The drink selection was top notch. Prices are very good considering the quality of food. I would recommend this place to any and everyone who has the inclination to eat drink and be merry. 10 out of 10!

Small place with an outstanding beer selection. They have one of the most extensive beer lists I have ever seen. They are known for their burgers, and they did not disappoint. You can get an excellent burger and fries here for less than $15. We waited for a bit too long after ordering to get our food, but overall it was a great experience.
Food was decent. The staff did seem like they wanted to there. Service was slow. Probably have better luck at the Frisch's around he corner.

Best Salad option downtown period. They are very quick in assembling it and there are a wide variety of options. The pick your own allows you to make a different salad every time or to create your own favorite.  The portions are pretty generous, and the only downside is it is a little expensive but it is always very filling and surprisingly delicious.
The open at 6am! Food and service is ready, you can order eggs, omelets...hot food or if you prefer they have croissants,  bagels,  muffins, etc. Service is fats and pleasant.
A real nicw coffee house. In the lobby of the westin hotel. Downtown Cincinnati. Decent breakfast menu. A variety of dishes.
Lots of awesome choices, especially with the salads! Food is delicious,  the employees are fast and friendly.

Everything is so fresh and light. Definitely does not leave you feeling overly stuffed. The nacho chips are all freshly made along with the black bean chili and.. well everything else on the menu here! The cauliflower buffalo "wings" are a great appetizer and you have to try the vegan chili. You can't believe it's vegan!
Great craft cocktails, delicious scratch-made desserts. The hard-core meat eater in our group loved his vegetarian nachos! Plenty of vegan options.
Great service, excellent selection of Sunday brunch items. Gluten free options are marvelous! Thanks for caring about us.
Best food better staff.  I love this place so much I have to refrain from eating it everyday.  10/10 would go into a food coma again.
Great food. Good drinks. Friendly service. Neat spot

Relaxed vibe with friendly staff. Simple, classic, cheap menu with daily specials.  Had their Friday special of fish sandwich with fries and drink for $7.50. Friend had their bacon cheeseburger and fries which came out to around $9. 

The burger and fish sandwich were delicious. Burger was juicy and the fish was crispy. No frills, just good and comforting. My only complaint was their fries were hard and stale. However, fries aside I will come back for more!

Great little burger joint, been coming here since I was a kid. The burgers are tasty, especially if you get the habanero cheese. Service is usually pretty good, lots of the same people been working there since before I started coming in.

They do not offer fountain drinks, or milkshakes. You see yourself and pay at the register. I like the atmosphere, and although the menu is not extensive, I love the food. I would recommend this place to any of my friends, and they have a kids menu.
Great prices, good food, cheap beer, and the ambience of a quaint little neighborhood gathering spot.  Highly recommended.
Its a nice place. This was my first time there and the cheese 🍔 was awesome! I will be going back....

**For all Vegetarian lovers: If you are vegetarian and looking for a black bean burger, this is the best place around Mt. Lookout. 
It has nice local vibe with cozy atmosphere. If you are luck enough you'll see a toy train running over you which fascinates me every single time!

I enjoyed my visit to Zip's Cafe. The food was good. The place has real character; feels like home. Plenty of things to try. Mostly burgers and sandwiches. Parking can be tight as there isn't a dedicated parking lot. Most of the parking meters near Zip's take either credit cards or change.
Fine spot for quality burgers. it was so fresh. the staff was very welcoming and observant. bring your hunger - portions are generous. mood here is similar to fresno's scene.
If you are ever even remotely in the area of this spot, do yourself a favor and STOP!! Most amazing onion rings I have ever had and a Cheers atmosphere!! Definitely going back!

Oh em gee... Outstanding burgers and chili! definitely make room for both and you won't be disappointed. Also makes a great long island..  Totally recommended, just note they have very low lighting...

The place is definitely a hole in the wall, but it was one of the best meals I've ever had. The kale salad is amazing. Cookies were delicious. Sandwich was a little messy (fell apart) but tasted excellent. Great local establishment! Very reasonably priced.

No longer Gilpin's. Employees said, "Same owner, different menu." I was really jonesing for the Doritos sandwich. The new place doesn't make that and doesn't make anything comparable. Completely different style of food. I can't rate the food because I didn't choose to eat there. Just know that this place isn't Gilpin's.

When you think "sandwich on a bagel" you think of a thick piece of bread. Not here. The pretzel bun is stellar, the ingredients are fresh and the service is friendly. Stop in for a fresh sandwich and support local!

The food is good, you don't get a ton of food so you may leave a little hunger but what you get is tasty.  I had the burger which are steamed here, I really like steamed burgers because they stay nice and juicy without all of the grease.  If you are downtown and want a sandwich or burger this isn't a bad choice. They also serve late at night which is nice.
Great place for a sloppy, horribly unhealthy sandwich. If I were drunk and hungry, or sober and just coming off of a meat-free diet I would gorge myself here.

One of my favorite places to eat. They know us there and are always happy to see us. Food is served quickly and orders are always accurate. The only negative about this location is the parking lot. While it is getting better, it is littered with potholes and uneven pavement.

I'm not sure why I had to wait for ten minutes to get  my order, especially when  I saw the waitress not too busy to come and pack out my order  as well as a cook who instead of helping me, sat down and got on his cell phone (what happened to coming to work to WORK).  So finally  when I got help it was from the cashier who took my order and he had to be new, so I do t blame him but the vets who were there not doing anything,  like the waitress talking to a customer  who was done with their meal already.  And this is not the first time any other time I come Thur the drive  Thur and it's just as bad depending on the  day.
I love this little cozy location. It was perfect for this rainy New Year's Eve. Fast and friendly service. Food was excellent as usual. Parking lot is terrible. Horrible pot holes. So be careful.
This place us great! I love the food and the people that work there. The aosphere is great and it always smells very welcoming. More people should appreciate this restaurant mire than it already us.
Eat there often.  It is pricey,  but always hot and delicious.  Staff is friendly. I wish they had large drink cups because their sweet tea is the best.

Always a pleasant experience going to Price Hill Chili. Food is always spectacular, service is fast and friendly, prices are always fair. I love coming here on my lunch break. Would definitely recommend this place to anybody deciding to try it.

Stopped in before work and had breakfast with some co workers. Food was served hot and fast. Janet was our server and she was johnny on the spot with the food and the never ending coffee refills. Food tasted awesome, kudos to the cook as well. This place definitely started our day off on the right foot. Will definitely go again.

First time here, excellent location.  Service was fantastic and the food was great! I had the two egg breakfast with goetta and home fries.  Everything was done perfect and we'll definitely be coming back!

The chili was great! I had a five way and cheese coney First time of being back there in 20 yrs it has grown into a very popular eating spot with an extensive menu. The place was packed but service was still good.

There is a rather varied menu.  It is refreshing to be in a restaurant where the owner still walks around and personally will see that you are enjoying your meal.  Service felt very personal and the food was as expected.

Just tried the Boom Boom Burger.  This is a unique burger.   Zesty sauce made in house, 1/2 pound of beef, jalapenos, bacon, tomato, lettuce, and grilled onions.  I love it!

Great chili spaghetti at a good price.  Abundant serving with plenty of crackers.  Service was outstanding!  It was the most diverse crowd is ever seen in a restaurant in Cincinnati.  That was refreshing in and of itself.  I'll grab a bite there again!

Old school Americana type diner food and the BEST Cincinnati style chili you’ll ever eat. There aren’t too many places like this around here anymore much less the entire country. Excellent overall food and friendly staff but slow service and wait to get your food. However, it really is worth the wait. Once you receive your order, you’re in diner food heaven!
There’s a good reason this place is always busy.

Cincinnati style chili spaghetti that's better than Skyline. there's not much you can say about Cincinnati style chili except that it seems like a recipe they came from cleaning out the pantry. Maybe its origins slide in the great depression where ingredients were sparse. In any case the pleasant ridge chili is better than the local market leader skyline in my opinion.
I love PRC!gravy cheese fries are the best. I don't go late at night though... people are stupid but the food is always great.
American food at this place - delicious. A favorite evening place of mine. This place has a cool design. Similar to a place in Denver I loved.

Had a great evening as I was part of Moerlein’s service offering for a pal’s wedding rehearsal dinner. The food was immaculate. So immaculate, that I forgot to pull out my camera to capture the great quality and the great experience. But I did however manage to snag this as another pal enjoys his bread. Can’t wait to go back very very soon.
Had early evening dinner. This place is amazing. Our waiter was on top of things the whole time and we wanted for nothing. We will be back. I recommend you go there, if you get the chance.

The best part was as the amazing service from our server Mikey. He was a attentive and timely. He recommended great drinks and food. My fish tacos where excellent. The creme brulee was a little over cooked. Otherwise, the atmosphere was amazing for catching up with friends for a birthday gathering. We will return for sure!

A great atmosphere with a lot of glass walls and a great overlook of the river and Great American Ballpark. The staff was quick with our order and attentive. A great place to have a beer on a nice afternoon.
This location is absolutely outstanding. The staff was very sociable and kind. The prices are well within reason for the quality. This place has good reviews for a reason.

Love this pub. Great Sheppard's pie. Fish and chips were just the way I like them. House ketchup is so good. Desserts here are worth the trip. We stop in for sweets and drinks after dinner somewhere else. Bread pudding is off the charts.They have the double chocolate stout on tap and they pour it perfectly. ❤

Excellent food as my girlfriend and I ordered Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict and Shepherd's Pie...YUM, perfectly prepared! Our server, Anna was phenomenal; on top of checking up on us, friendly and informative!
The Only slightly awkward thing was first walking in and no one to greet us, as the host/hostess stand was located about 40 feet into the restaurant on the other side of the bar and any open tables had 'reserved' signs on them to deter people from seating themselves. Bad Idea. We saw one couple sit at the bar and left after 10 minutes without service while two more couples came in and sat themselves. Hmm.
We will definitely come back for the fine food and service like Anna, but they Really need to drop the not-so-helpful host and re-arrange the host stand, as THIS is your guests first impression!

Great service, great food, great brew. All at a reasonable price. Enjoy a traditional meal, or try a new taste off the menu. Haggis fritters might remind the Cincinnati crowd of goetta, for good reason! Give it a try, come back for more!  Live music makes this a special experience.
This place has amazing food! Very delicious and wonderful atmosphere. Enjoyed it very much.
Good food and kilts, nice location around a lot of things. The tables in the middle suck in terms of comfort and location, so definitely ask for a booth or somewhere different.

Wow! Wow! Chef returning to Nicola's is fantastic. The dishes are modern and full of excellent surprises. Formidable wine list of difficult to find Italian gems. Incredible and very knowledgeable service. Nicola's is one of our favorites that we don't often visit. This was another great dining experience with a table in the reserved party room looking down at the fireplace. The meal as usual was very good with service to match. We won't wait so long to return.

Hands down best meal I've eaten. The atmosphere was very romantic. Our server was very knowledgeable and a big help. So hard to choose between the many great selections, but we were able to customize a sampling and try everything we wanted. Sad that we ran out of room for dessert. We will definitely be back.

Great classic Italian food. The bolognese is crazy good, I could've eaten three bowls. The anchovies on the Caesar salad were a nice touch as well. Also loved the variety of bread brought to the table
The food was delicious! Well prepared and great presentation. Service was also excellent without being overbearing. Will definitely dine here again!

This place came highly recommended, so we decided to try it out to celebrate our anniversary (1/19/18). When we first arrived, we were greeted very kindly. We were then seated and when the waitress came over, she seemed friendly at first, but after she came back the second time, all she wanted to do was the very minimum. It's sad when we learn more about the menu and drinks from the tables around us, which had the same waitress as we did. The food here is amazing, but our first experience was not that great of one. We will be back to try it out again based solely on the food and atmosphere, but we won't be back any time soon.
I always get too happy during happy hour here if you know what I mean. The cocktails definitely sneak up on you. They go down so easily I always lose track. The food is also very good.

I have to give it another try. But I really had a great time with a friend. We enjoyed making our own rolls for appetizer. My food wasn’t that tasty, I ordered the Vegan congee and it was missing flavor. Asked for burn garlic oil and that really helped it a lot! That was thanks to my friend. Happy they have vegan options. Staff was friendly. Great environment and vibe.

DELICIOUS! Whatever I get I always get a side of kimchi which always makes my meal. The staff is friendly and helpful, the cocktails are delicious, and they have a nice selection of on tap. Being in a brewery town, I like that the list isn't overwhelming! Go, sit at a community table and have a great meal!
Delicious! Their short ribs melt in your mouth. Just wish they gave you more meat in the bowl. I will go back next time I'm in the area.
I come down from Dayton to eat here once or twice a year. It's one of my favorite places to eat. Delicious food, American craft beer, happy hour specials, all in a modern setting. Excellent.

A singular encounter with greatness. The sweet Basil shrimp was peerless. Flavor balance and composition simply delightful. Service right on target. One of the best Chinese experiences in town. Will visit again without doubt.

Shanghai Mama's is excellent! I usually get the chicken veggie stir fry, which is delicious. I highly recommended the pork dumplings. Prices are very reasonable. It was quite busy today, which is common at noon. The service was lacking, but that's very unusual, so I don't hold it against them.

We absolutely love this restaurant. Their more expensive items are definitely well worth the money. Their seafood dishes are out of this world. The braised prawns and fried fish dishes are worth writing home about. The Mongolian beef makes you want to ride a horse and throw some hatchets.

Excellent flavors and a large menu. I'm looking forward to going back and trying other dishes! The Pad Thai noodles were some of the best I've had. I like the quirky and casual atmosphere. 
The servers were attentive and the kitchen had the food ready quickly.

Bren an amazing soul of this establishment, help me navigate the menu and give me the tools to help get me fed. They personally walked me to the bathroom and help me live my best life. Thank you Greg for an amazing staff and team whom you head, to help allow me to live my best live as a LGBTQIA person of color.

Everyone has to try their waffles. You've never had anything like it. The beer is great and they have a great rotational selection. If you love Belgium beers, this is the place to go. Obviously, breakfast/brunch is when everyone goes, so make sure to get there before 10am or you are going wait. You can buy 4 packs of their waffles too. So, f you can't get in, you can at least take some home. Full bakery, so come hungry.

Went to brunch and really loved the atmosphere.  Lively and chatty staff.  Waffles were delicious and you can buy a pack to take with.  We had a waffle sandwich with ham and brie and a breakfast bowl with some pork hash.  Both were fabulous.  Enjoyed a classic mimosa and a bloody Mary.  I wouldn't recommend the bloody mary, but everything else was great. Would recommend a visit here!  .

Great for brunch or breakfast. I did not like the waffles, but they are a different style more dense/hard type of Belgium waffle. The best version of them I had was with the chicken and waffles. I would highly reccomend this dish! Otherwise I really enjoyed the Belgium toast, and coffee. Absolutely delicious. I would go back if ever in town again.

My family and I visited late Sunday morning. It was crowded. Wait time for a table was 20 minutes. Service was good. Staff was friendly. Food was good. We enjoyed lattes, mimosas, chicken and waffles and waffle with ricotta cream which was delicious. I would definitely visit again to try more menu items.

Delicious brunch! Not cheap but totally worth it.  I had the salmon baguette with frites. I order this when I get the chance because it is so yummy. Obviously people come here for the chicken and waffles which my husband had and I sampled. Totally worth it and delicious. You cant go wrong with any item on their menu.
One of my favorite restaurants in the US!!!!!! Such a food place: amazing delicious food, great service and not expensive! Omg their coconut soup for starters is heaven!!!!!
One of the best restarts in the city! The house-made yogurt is awesome and it gives their dishes a unique flavor. The naan bread is always fluffy and perfectly chewy.
One of the best Indian restaurants in Cincinnati. Food has been consistently amazing over 15+ years of visits. Never disappoints.

I was charged $16 for one takeout entree and they didn’t even include utensils. The food is just average - they have a nice dining room but if you want really good Indian food you have to go north in the city.

IT'S SO GOOD!!!  One of the best Indian places I've been to.  I just wish they served goat meat. 
 The price is decent, and the food is always amazing.  The garlic naan knocks my socks off every time!

This place is a gem.  They don't have a huge menu but what they do serve is exceptional.  I had the clam chowder and lobster roll, both of which were rich in flavor and tasted fresh which is suggestions hard to get being so far from the sea. Definitely worth going here if you enjoy seafood as much as I do.
Great food, great lobster and great service, sorry to hear they closed. Wife loved The Anchor😭

Perhaps I'm not as good a judge of food but a 32.00 lobster roll should not taste like mayonnaise sandwich on a hot dog bun accompanied by a couple pounds of fries.

Great location and atmosphere I just found the food less than in quality while priced with the best.

Appetizers were good, mains were OK but overpriced, and desserts were mediocre to bad.  Service was also bad - forgot one appetizer and never asked if I wanted another glass of wine  (I did).  For $200 I expected much, much better.

I wish I could rate this place on the food, but unfortunately I haven't been able to try it. Went on a Thursday night, not 15 minutes before they closed, not 30 minutes before they closed, but an hour before they closed. And somehow I was still informed they were not open. Am I supposed to call now before showing up just to verify they're not closed early? If you don't want to be open until 10, that's fine, but change your hours online.

We really enjoyed the the style of the place. The main dining room is absolutely beautiful and the bar is nice. Parking was a bit tough because it's street parking.
I got the chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries. The food was pretty average and a bit dry. The price for it was a bit expensive. Their flights and drinks weren't too bad and you can try a few drinks.
The dining area was pretty loud and busy. It was full when we came, but we didn't wait long. Staff was nice, but it was really hard to hear them and our party.
I recommend this place for drinks, a casual date, or small group hang out. I would recommend trying other meals and drinks!

Great place. Built from an old church. Count on a wait so head downstairs to the lower bar and enjoy some libations, totally worth it. Once seated be ready to possibly share your table.  Not bad though.  Food is really good.  Meats, meats, meats all good. The burger is a definite if it's your first time since they only make 27 per day! 🍔🍔. There are some fish and vegetarian options.  Don't hesitate give them a try you will not be disappointed.

We scheduled a private event - my husband's 50th Birthday party. Excellent service from start to finish. The staff assisting us upstairs were so helpful and took great care of us. Great venue for a party. Our guests loved the food and there was plenty provided.  Overall an excellent experience.

Fantastic experience. Staff were incredibly friendly and attentive. The bartenders were awesome in Nellie's Tap Room. We stopped in for a drink as the first place on our self designed mini-Pub Crawl, and ended up finishing the night there.

My girlfriend and I stopped in at Nellie's for a beer and a snack. The beer was great.  Fondue was awesome - watch the cheese to dipped item ratio though. The container is not as deep as it looks. 

We had a short delay in one food item that we couldn't wait on.  The staff could not have better about the situation. They took the item off the bill and gave us a credit on top before we could say anything. 

It's so nice to see a business taking the long view on customer service. We will definitely be back with friends.

I came to this quaint pub for some Thai food and I must say I was not disappointed. The Pork Chow Mein Noodle was amazing, with some nice vegetable garnish with some very respectable prices and lunch deals. Will be returning fairly soon!
I've eaten here twice. Both roast dinners were delicious and plentiful.  Really friendly staff.

We informed the staff of my friend’s nut allergy which they ignored and he consequently ended up in hospital. 
The staff were told, said they couldn’t guarantee anything - would’ve been great if they said that before serving the food! 
Avoid this place.

Homely and classic vibe. Excellent customer service very accommodating, professional staff. Excellent kitchen on sundays had the smokey burger perfectly seasoned packed with flavour and great value for money. Compliments to such a superb pub, my friends and I left very satisfied.
Always good. Decent beer, friendly staff, nice atmosphere.

Loud environment okay food but nothing great. Did not agree with my stomach. The noise was the real reason for only 3 star's might haven been 4 if it was a little more intimate. Not a cheap place for the loud dining experience. Felt like I was at golden corral with a waiter. I had trouble hearing the couple we ate with.

Service was 5 stars food was 3 stars. I didn’t get there until around 9:15. Firstly, my waiter started me off with a delicious cocktail. Then, even after closing they made sure I didn’t want anything else from the salad bar before breaking it down! He also took a couple of pictures for me 😂💪🏾
This establishment is great. You have to enjoy different types of ethnic food. Brazilian buffet is the way to go. Don't go here if you don't like meat, this is meat eaters heaven.
Meat gluttony paradise.  Quite economical ($41 and tip) if you just eat.  Very easy to spend twice that on drinks, as several of the people I went with did.

I always love eating here. What's not to like about all-you-can-eat steak. Their salad bar is pretty awesome too. The food was good as always but the service especially from the bar was a little slow tonight. Otherwise we had an enjoyable meal and walked away super full.

Hands down the best steak in Cincinnati. Any cut you get, will be amazing. Make sure to let your server know what you like and trust their recommendation, they will not serve you wrong.  Wine selection is fantastic and their desert selection is great. Make sure to make reservations. Great for work events.

This is a beautiful restaurant. I came in wanting a steak dinner. Staff were very friendly and attentive. Service was great. I got into a bit of a misunderstanding with the server about the steak I wanted, but the manager bent over backwards to make it right with me, so all good. The care factor was very impressive. Can't wait to go back again next time I'm in Cincinnati.

This is by far the absolute best steak house in the Cincinnati area.... 
The food is amazing, staff as well.... 
They have a great wine selection & a nice outdoor patio area for cigar smokers.!! 
Great local place..!!

Beautiful restaurant. Took my wife and her parents to celebrate anniversaries. We were treated with the upmost care. Our server Gary had  such a great personality and really helped us to relax and enjoy what was to be some of the best food we have ever had. Gary recommended the butter pie and it was amazing.

This restaurant was awesome.  The food was delicious and the service was top notch.  There was a live band that was pretty good and the crowd was lively. If there was anything bad, it was the fact that the dance floor was really small.  Other than that, the place was a complete joy. Can't wait to go again. We are from Columbus and didn't know there was a Jeff Ruby here also so we will definitely be going there and hoping that the one here is just as good.

Very cool place, kind of in an odd place, you have to go in a building and walk to it. Other than that no complaints. Nice view from within the city, priced pretty well for the quality of food. We went for my birthday and they gave us a free desert so huge shout out to them! Highly recommend for nice nights out for an anniversary, birthday, or to just have a nice sit down dinner!

Excellent restaurant. The service is really good. The location is great, it overlooks fountain square. We’ve had pizza, pasta and many of the appetizers and they are all amazing. I recommend the bruschetta and the fried cheese.

Still one of my favorite restaurants, although its lost some of its luster.  It's showing its age a bit.  Service doesn't quite have the intangible extra it once had.  The food is still good and it still has the spectacular view of Fountain Square.  Overall, very good, but not great.

We organised our corporate dinners here, so was our this one. Food was great & our colleagues have been taken care well. Ambiance was nice because we were larger group so they did provide us private room. They were only people who acknowledge our booking on Saturday for dinner placed on Monday. I give only 1 star less, just because my usual experience is time they take to serve food it can go up to an hour, so plan your time accordingly. While this might be just because they were trying to maintain quality or one of cook is on long weekend ;-)

Every time I go downtown to meet my investment team they always take me to palominos. They know it's my all-time favorite for lunch. Overlooks Fountain Square Downtown , perfect spot for lunch and dinner.
Went before the dinner rush. Made for a quiet, delightful dining experience. Overall, I really enjoyed the atmosphere. And the entrees were delicious.

Teller’s is definitely an under-rated Hyde Park spot. Good happy hour, food has always been great, and the atmosphere and space are super cool. Alert: There is a rooftop that many people don’t know about. Great spot for a bottle of wine and some apps. Tip: if you go for brunch, beware that they can’t sell alcohol (read: bloodies and mimosas) until after Noon.

We came with a party of 17 for drinks and appetizers with no reservations.  They bent over backwards to accommodate us.  The service was impeccable. The food was delicious.  We had chicken quesadillas, creole shrimp, and buffalo chicken egg rolls; 3 servings of each and was plenty for all of us.  The waiter kept our drinks full and we left very happy. I would highly recommend!

A great stop for brunch! We had a great meal at Teller’s! Each of our orders was fresh and well prepared. Very friendly staff, and plenty of beer options for those interested. The closest parking is behind the building in a paid public lot, but a short walk away. I like how they set the atmosphere as a bank, from the bank vault and teller windows to the deposit boxes as condiment holders – it’s well thought out.
Fantastic drink and food menu. I had the nitro chocolate stout and buttermilk fried chicken and it was amazing! Red snapper is incredible too. Cheesecake was huge and yummy

My small dish of mediocre pasta was $24.  Burnt bread was $7. (Literally 5 slices of bread was $7)  A small chicken breast with a little cream sauce was $26. The food wasn't bad, it wasn't anything more spectacular than could be fixed easily at home for one fifth the price.  Had the meals been priced appropriately,  I'd had a better review of average food at an average price, but instead its average food at an exorbitant price.

Good solid place.  Very small and loud. Meals are tasty, but portion sizes were smaller.   Was a good one time try for me.

Brussel sprouts-salty
Scallop-tasty, but small
Kale salad-salty
Pasta- delicious

Elegant, hip dining with an intimate atmosphere. Expect excellence from each contemporary course selection with a cocktail menu to match. Do yourself a favor and save room for dessert while adding this delightful place to your repertoire of short list favorites.

A small and very cozy atmosphere. The food quality, flavor, and presentation was excellent. The service was also top notch. Very professional and friendly. I am already planning the dishes for my next visit.
Honestly my favorite evening place. Looking forward to returning with my relatives. Makes me feel like I am back in Tucson.
Delicious food when they are having there festival.
Church was beautiful.  Went for the Greek festival. Thoroughly enjoyed!!
Best Greek Festival. We go every year!!
Very nice
One star for letting the festival employees that were manning the rides smoke around our kids.
Breath taking beauty and craftsmanship.
Beautiful Temple ass for garnish catering

I am new in the area and was very disappointed with my Friday night visit to the Wise temple. As a former office of a reform congregation I found the people very cold and uninviting. I was surprised there were no greaters and there was no effort by any of the congregants to approach or engage a stranger in their midst.
Beautiful architecture!
Beautiful architecture!

I stopped in to visit the St Louis Church unfortunately there wasn't a Mass at that time of day. I love the solitude that St Louis Church offers right there in that neighborhood in the city. I'm going to make sure to attend a Mass when I'm next in the city!
Lively and lovely
Fr Angie gives a message you can leave the service with every mass.  Straightforward and understandable. Wonderful priest.
Nice
Beautiful Church. Over the years there's always been a great Priests there.
I got chocked up as I marveled at the architecture in this building the mosaic pavement is something to see. Pls take time to visit this house of or lord.
It is not the actual physical exertion that counts towards one´s progress, nor the nature of the task, but by the spirit of faith with which it is undertaken. In Thee, O Lord, have I put my hope.
This church is very good and big. I can pray here and spend lots of time in church.Good priest, nice environment and caring people.
Convenient parking and beautiful, historic church.  Mass times are accommodating and spread out over the weekend.

I went to this church every time I went to Cincinnati to visit my son and his Family.   I visit other church but every time I go back to this one.  It is a very nice structure church with lots of statues.  I feel holiness of this church.
My soul is fed here, and this is the most loving, welcoming, inclusive parish family that I have ever been privileged to be a part of.   I just wish that I would have known about this parish sooner.

Catholic parish like no other I've seen in my 68 years. Very parishioner led with very cool pastor of The Marianist order. Choir at 11:00a is excellent with added professional tenor and baritone voices that would knock your socks off! Most enjoyed by Catholics that have left their earlier traditional ways. Progressive yet dwells in a classic, historic church building in the inner city of Cincinnati but not downtown. Walnut Hills neighborhood. Exceptionally upbeat.

If you are looking for a traditional Catholic Church, this is NOT the one for you. There are no kneelers and it was so loud it was hard to even focus on prayer. It felt irreverent. Everyone was incredibly friendly - it just felt more social than about adoring and offering the mass up to God. They said the apostles creed instead of the nicene creed. The "introduce yourself" at the beginning of mass and the sign of peace lasted almost 5 minutes each and turned into everyone casually chatting and moving about the church pews. I had a harder time focusing on prayer than when I have my three kids under the age of 5 with me. The priest sat in the front pew instead of at the front of church. And admittedly this is one of my pet peeves, but people clapped after church. What are they clapping for? Again, it seemed more like a social event than a reverent worship.
Very welcoming, warm environment.  Fellow parishioners feel like family.  You feel loved and accepted here no matter who you are.  Truly a wonderful parish.
Yummy fried cod, mac & cheese & cole slaw.
Don't know.  But I drive children to and from the fair view school daily.. great kids
Good Place of Beautiful Mosque Mashallah

MaShaAllah! It’s a wonderful Masjid!
We passed like 3 days here in Jamat from Detroit, Michigan. Brothers are really welcoming. After-all its a nice Muslim community. 👍👍🕋🕌📿

A great place for Muslims to gather everyday, weekly, and on major religious occasions for ritual prayers and other community activities. This place offers a variety of things, materials and services to both Muslims and non-Muslims. One of the most important things about the Islamic Association of Cincinnati is that it plays a dynamic role in bringing different colors and creeds together and sparking love rather than hatred among people of different backgrounds. I recommend everyone living in Cincinnati to visit Clifton Mosque at least once.
Engaging community. Every Sunday they volunteer food of about 120 homeless people in Cincinnati downtown.

We went to Creation Museum about 5yrs ago. It was an eye opening experience. Lots of things to see and very informative. I think we spent almost our entire day at the museum. What I enjoyed most from the museum was when they highlight creations from Christian perspective in contrast with Evolution.
I highly recommend this museum.

This place is full of very cool information. Be prepared to be inside for a while! Exhibits range from scripture to ancient creepy crawlers and dinosaur fossils! The free 4d theater was also a very nice touch! If you get hungry there is a pizza restaurant right in the middle of the building that tasted amazing and was moderately priced!!! Lots of fun for the whole family, just be prepared for a long day!!!

We took a group of 20 from our church. They ranged in age from 4 to 85. These is a lot of walking but it is very friendly to those with mobility issues. 
It was an outstanding part of our trip. We used both days that were included with our tickets and needed all of the time. The 4D theater presentation of "6 Days" was probably the highlight for most in our group. The children loved the large and safe playground. Be sure and take some time for the petting zoo and outdoor animal exhibits. It is a beautiful place with many interesting and informative exhibits. 
We certainly will plan to return for another visit to this and the Ark Encounter.
We purchased Groupon tickets that saved us over 20% per ticket! A great value!

This place is required viewing regardless of your religious views.  For Christians, this place will answer many questions and lift your face in the view of creation that is consistent with scripture. For those who are not Believers it is an opportunity to see in compelling fashion why believers are strongly in favor of the creation story. It's amazing to see how science supports scriptures that are 6000 years old. It is also worth the extra $9 to view the planetarium movie. This movie provides incredible perspective on the size of the universe and also provides additional scientific support for intelligent creation.

We've been going to the Creation Museum since opening day, they've consistently gotten better and had a richer experience for everyone visiting. My kids completely love the stargazers planetarium. It really puts the whole world into perspective. They also have a new 4D movie that was a really fun. We went to the coffee shop outside that was new and it was amazing, except the wait time was quite long. Well worth the money for the visit.
